Hello,
sometimes you care about the order of rules. Therefore I created a R=
uleChain, which is a rule itself:

@Rule
public TestRule chain =3D RuleChai=
n.outerRule(new FirstRule()).enclose(new SecondRule());

What do you thing =
about the naming outerRule and enclose?

What do you think about starting w=
ith the outer rule instead of starting with the inner rule:

@Rule
public T=
estRule chain =3D RuleChain.innerRule(new SecondRule()).enclosedBy(new Firs=
tRule());

If you want to see the code, look at https://github.com/stefanbi=
rkner/junit/commit/3584c44bedd8705f30dda4f4213fa45655b998c7
The issue is ht=
tps://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/193
